comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Probably Charles Clive Bayley, the British Consul General at New York from 1915 to 1919. See The New York Times, October 2, 1915 The New York Times, February 22, 1919

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: If so, his wife is the former Constance Ricardo. And they arrived in New York in October 1915.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.geni.com/people/Charles-Bayley/6000000016300961888 gives his full name as Charles Theophilius Richard Clive Bayley (1864 - 1923)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for your research. Wonder how Bain came up with that spelling of the name Clive.  We'll make the correction and add some of this information to the record the next time we update.
